00081 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082 //  CLASS : sc_lv_base
00083 //
00084 //  Arbitrary size logic vector base class.
00085 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00086 
00087 class SC_API sc_lv_base
00088     : public sc_proxy<sc_lv_base>
00089 {
00090     friend class sc_bv_base;
00091 
00092 
00093     void init( int length_, const sc_logic& init_value = SC_LOGIC_X );
00094 
00095     void assign_from_string( const std::string& );
00096 
00097 public:
00098 
00099     // typedefs
00100 
00101     typedef sc_proxy<sc_lv_base>  base_type;
00102     typedef base_type::value_type value_type;
00103 
00104 
00105     // constructors
00106 
00107     explicit sc_lv_base( int length_ = sc_length_param().len() )
00108         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00109         { init( length_ ); }
00110 
00111     explicit sc_lv_base( const sc_logic& a,
00112                          int length_ = sc_length_param().len()  )
00113         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00114         { init( length_, a ); }
00115 
00116     sc_lv_base( const char* a );
00117 
00118     sc_lv_base( const char* a, int length_ );
00119 
00120     template <class X>
00121     sc_lv_base( const sc_proxy<X>& a )
00122         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00123         { init( a.back_cast().length() ); base_type::assign_( a ); }
00124 
00125     sc_lv_base( const sc_lv_base& a );
00126 
00127 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00128 
00129     explicit sc_lv_base( const sc_unsigned& a )
00130         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00131         { init( a.length() ); base_type::assign_( a ); }
00132 
00133     explicit sc_lv_base( const sc_signed& a )
00134         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00135         { init( a.length() ); base_type::assign_( a ); }
00136 
00137     explicit sc_lv_base( const sc_uint_base& a )
00138         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00139         { init( a.length() ); base_type::assign_( a ); }
00140 
00141     explicit sc_lv_base( const sc_int_base& a )
00142         : m_len( 0 ), m_size( 0 ), m_data( 0 ), m_ctrl( 0 )
00143         { init( a.length() ); base_type::assign_( a ); }
00144 
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 
00148     // destructor
00149 
00150     virtual ~sc_lv_base()
00151         { delete [] m_data; }
00152 
00153 
00154     // assignment operators
00155

00157     sc_lv_base& operator = ( const sc_proxy<X>& a )
00158         { assign_p_( *this, a ); return *this; }
00159 
00160     sc_lv_base& operator = ( const sc_lv_base& a )
00161         { assign_p_( *this, a ); return *this; }
00162

00164

00166         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00167

00169         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00170

00172         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }

00175         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }

00178         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00179

00181         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }

00184         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00185

00187         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00188

00190         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00191

00193         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00194

00196         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00197

00199         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
00200 
00201     // common methods
00202 
00203     int length() const
00204         { return m_len; }
00205 
00206     int size() const
00207         { return m_size; }
00208 
00209     value_type get_bit( int i ) const;
00210     void set_bit( int i, value_type value );
00211 
00212     sc_digit get_word( int wi ) const
00213         { return m_data[wi]; }
00214 
00215         // note the test for out of range access here. this is necessary 
00216         // because of the hair-brained way concatenations are set up.
00217         // an extend_sign on a concatenation uses the whole length of 
00218         // the concatenation to determine how many words to set.
00219     void set_word( int wi, sc_digit w )
00220         { sc_assert ( wi < m_size ); m_data[wi] = w; }
00221          
00222 
00223     sc_digit get_cword( int wi ) const
00224         { return m_ctrl[wi]; }
00225 
00226     void set_cword( int wi, sc_digit w )
00227         { sc_assert ( wi < m_size ); m_ctrl[wi] = w; }
00228 
00229     void clean_tail();
00230 
00231 
00232     // other methods
00233 
00234     bool is_01() const;
00235 
00236 protected:
00237 
00238     int     m_len;   // length in bits
00239     int     m_size;  // size of the data array
00240     sc_digit* m_data;  // data array
00241     sc_digit* m_ctrl;  // dito (control part)
00242 };

00272 
00273 inline
00274 sc_lv_base::value_type
00275 sc_lv_base::get_bit( int i ) const
00276 {
00277     int wi = i / SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
00278     int bi = i % SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
00279     return value_type( ((m_data[wi] >> bi) & SC_DIGIT_ONE) |
00280                              (((m_ctrl[wi] >> bi) << 1) & SC_DIGIT_TWO) );
00281 }
00282 
00283 inline
00284 void
00285 sc_lv_base::set_bit( int i, value_type value )
00286 {
00287     int wi = i / SC_DIGIT_SIZE; // word index
00288     int bi = i % SC_DIGIT_SIZE; // bit index
00289     sc_digit mask = SC_DIGIT_ONE << bi;
00290     m_data[wi] |= mask; // set bit to 1
00291     m_ctrl[wi] |= mask; // set bit to 1
00292     m_data[wi] &= value << bi | ~mask;
00293     m_ctrl[wi] &= value >> 1 << bi | ~mask;
00294 }
00295 
00296 
00297 inline
00298 void
00299 sc_lv_base::clean_tail()
00300 {
00301     int wi = m_size - 1;
00302     int bi = m_len % SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
00303     sc_digit mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> (SC_DIGIT_SIZE - bi);
00304         if ( mask )
00305         {
00306                 m_data[wi] &= mask;
00307                 m_ctrl[wi] &= mask;
00308         }
00309 }

00313 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_proxy

00318 
00319 // bitwise operators and functions
00320 
00321 // bitwise complement
00322 
00323 template <class X>
00324 inline
00325 const sc_lv_base
00326 sc_proxy<X>::operator ~ () const
00327 {
00328     sc_lv_base a( back_cast() );
00329     return a.b_not();
00330 }

00336 inline
00337 X&
00338 operator &= ( sc_proxy<X>& px, const sc_proxy<Y>& py )
00339 {
00340     X& x = px.back_cast();
00341     sc_lv_base a( x.length() );
00342     a = py.back_cast();
00343     return b_and_assign_( x, a );
00344 }

00607 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_A(uint64)
00608 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_A(int64)
00609 
00610 #undef DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_A
00611 
00612 
00613 #define DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(tp)                                           \
00614 template <class X>                                                            \
00615 inline                                                                        \
00616 const sc_lv_base                                                              \
00617 operator ^ ( tp b, const sc_proxy<X>& px )                                    \
00618 {                                                                             \
00619     return ( px ^ b );                                                        \
00620 }
00621 
00622 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const char*)
00623 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const bool*)
00624 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const sc_logic*)
00625 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const sc_unsigned&)
00626 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const sc_signed&)
00627 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const sc_uint_base&)
00628 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(const sc_int_base&)
00629 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(unsigned long)
00630 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(long)
00631 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(unsigned int)
00632 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(int)
00633 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(uint64)
00634 DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B(int64)
00635 
00636 #undef DEFN_BITWISE_XOR_OP_T_B
00637 
00638 
00639 // bitwise left shift
00640 
00641 template <class X>
00642 inline
00643 const sc_lv_base
00644 sc_proxy<X>::operator << ( int n ) const
00645 {
00646     sc_lv_base a( back_cast().length()+n );
00647         a = back_cast();
00648     return ( a <<= n );
00649 }
00650 
00651 
00652 // bitwise right shift
00653 
00654 template <class X>
00655 inline
00656 const sc_lv_base
00657 sc_proxy<X>::operator >> ( int n ) const
00658 {
00659     sc_lv_base a( back_cast() );
00660     return ( a >>= n );
00661 }
00662 
00663 
00664 // bitwise left rotate
00665 
00666 template <class X>
00667 inline
00668 X&
00669 sc_proxy<X>::lrotate( int n )
00670 {
00671     X& x = back_cast();
00672     if( n < 0 ) {
00673         sc_proxy_out_of_bounds( "left rotate operation is only allowed with "
00674                                 "positive rotate values, rotate value = ", n );
00675         return x;
00676     }
00677     int len = x.length();
00678     n %= len;
00679     // x = (x << n) | (x >> (len - n));
00680     sc_lv_base a( x << n );
00681     sc_lv_base b( x >> (len - n) );
00682     int sz = x.size();
00683     for( int i = 0; i < sz; ++ i ) {
00684         x.set_word( i, a.get_word( i ) | b.get_word( i ) );
00685         x.set_cword( i, a.get_cword( i ) | b.get_cword( i ) );
00686     }
00687     x.clean_tail();
00688     return x;
00689 }
00690 
00691 template <class X>
00692 inline
00693 const sc_lv_base
00694 lrotate( const sc_proxy<X>& x, int n )
00695 {
00696     sc_lv_base a( x.back_cast() );
00697     return a.lrotate( n );
00698 }
00699 
00700 
00701 // bitwise right rotate
00702 
00703 template <class X>
00704 inline
00705 X&
00706 sc_proxy<X>::rrotate( int n )
00707 {
00708     X& x = back_cast();
00709     if( n < 0 ) {
00710         sc_proxy_out_of_bounds( "right rotate operation is only allowed with "
00711                                 "positive rotate values, rotate value = ", n );
00712         return x;
00713     }
00714     int len = x.length();
00715     n %= len;
00716     // x = (x >> n) | (x << (len - n));
00717     sc_lv_base a( x >> n );
00718     sc_lv_base b( x << (len - n) );
00719     int sz = x.size();
00720     for( int i = 0; i < sz; ++ i ) {
00721         x.set_word( i, a.get_word( i ) | b.get_word( i ) );
00722         x.set_cword( i, a.get_cword( i ) | b.get_cword( i ) );
00723     }
00724     x.clean_tail();
00725     return x;
00726 }
00727 
00728 template <class X>
00729 inline
00730 const sc_lv_base
00731 rrotate( const sc_proxy<X>& x, int n )
00732 {
00733     sc_lv_base a( x.back_cast() );
00734     return a.rrotate( n );
00735 }
00736 
00737 
00738 // bitwise reverse
00739 
00740 template <class X>
00741 inline
00742 const sc_lv_base
00743 reverse( const sc_proxy<X>& x )
00744 {
00745     sc_lv_base a( x.back_cast() );
00746     return a.reverse();
00747 }
00748 
00749 
00750 // relational operators
00751 
00752 template <class X, class Y>
00753 inline
00754 bool
00755 operator == ( const sc_proxy<X>& px, const sc_proxy<Y>& py )
00756 {
00757     const X& x = px.back_cast();
00758     const Y& y = py.back_cast();
00759     int x_len = x.length();
00760     int y_len = y.length();
00761     if( x_len != y_len ) {
00762         return false;
00763     }
00764     int sz = x.size();
00765     for( int i = 0; i < sz; ++ i ) {
00766         if( x.get_word( i ) != y.get_word( i ) ||
00767             x.get_cword( i ) != y.get_cword( i ) ) {
00768             return false;
00769         }
00770     }
00771     return true;
00772 }
00773 
00774 
00775 #define DEFN_REL_OP_T(tp)                                                     \
00776 template <class X>                                                            \
00777 inline                                                                        \
00778 bool                                                                          \
00779 sc_proxy<X>::operator == ( tp b ) const                                       \
00780 {                                                                             \
00781     const X& x = back_cast();                                                 \
00782     sc_lv_base y( x.length() );                                               \
00783     y = b;                                                                    \
00784     return ( x == y );                                                        \
00785 }
00786 
00787 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const char*)
00788 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const bool*)
00789 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const sc_logic*)
00790 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const sc_unsigned&)
00791 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const sc_signed&)
00792 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const sc_uint_base&)
00793 DEFN_REL_OP_T(const sc_int_base&)
00794 DEFN_REL_OP_T(unsigned long)
00795 DEFN_REL_OP_T(long)
00796 DEFN_REL_OP_T(unsigned int)
00797 DEFN_REL_OP_T(int)
00798 DEFN_REL_OP_T(uint64)
00799 DEFN_REL_OP_T(int64)
00800 
00801 #undef DEFN_REL_OP_T

01210 
01211 template <class T>
01212 inline
01213 sc_concref_r<sc_subref_r<T>,sc_lv_base>
01214 concat( sc_subref<T> a, const char* b )

01267 
01268 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01269 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_subref<X>
01270 //
01271 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy part selection (r-value and l-value).
01272 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01273 
01274 template <class X>
01275 inline
01276 sc_subref<X>&
01277 sc_subref<X>::operator = ( const sc_subref_r<X>& b )
01278 {
01279     sc_lv_base t( b ); // (partial) self assignment protection
01280     int len = sc_min( this->length(), t.length() );
01281     if( ! this->reversed() ) {
01282         for( int i = len - 1; i >= 0; -- i ) {
01283             this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_lo + i, t[i].value() );
01284         }
01285     } else {
01286         for( int i = len - 1; i >= 0; -- i ) {
01287             this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_lo - i, t[i].value() );
01288         }
01289     }
01290     return *this;
01291 }
01292 
01293 template <class X>
01294 inline
01295 sc_subref<X>&
01296 sc_subref<X>::operator = ( const sc_subref<X>& b )
01297 {
01298     sc_lv_base t( b ); // (partial) self assignment protection
01299     int len = sc_min( this->length(), t.length() );
01300     if( ! this->reversed() ) {
01301         for( int i = len - 1; i >= 0; -- i ) {
01302             this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_lo + i, t[i].value() );
01303         }
01304     } else {
01305         for( int i = len - 1; i >= 0; -- i ) {
01306             this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_lo - i, t[i].value() );
01307         }
01308     }
01309     return *this;
01310 }
01311
